metadata.Title: CVE-2015-4335 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Redis before 2.8.21 and 3.x before 3.0.2 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary Lua bytecode via the eval command. It was discovered that Redis incorrectly handled eval commands. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4335` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

redis - 5:4.0.9-1
redis-sentinel - 5:4.0.9-1
redis-server - 5:4.0.9-1
redis-tools - 5:4.0.9-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> xenial already has the code patched

criterions.comment: redis package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5:4.0.9-1').
